node.title: How to output the thermal stress?
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
Is there any quantity could represent the thermal stress (stress induced by the temperature changes and  the inhomogeneous distribution of temperature ) and output it ?
Thanks in advance.

Sorry I'm concerned about the thermal stress rather than the thermal strian. Maybe you means using the σ=E·ε to obtain it, where σ is stress, E is the Young's modulus, ε is the thermal strain.
But it only reflect the thermal stress induced by the temperature changes, without the inhomogeneous distribution of temperature.
@RECHOA could you write down the expression for the thermal stress you are referring to?

I'm struggling to find such a expression for the thermal stress, so i turned to the experienced researchers here to help me find a expression or  a quantity of stress could reflect the temperature influence.

node.title: Which kernel should be used?
node.bodyText:
Dear MOOSE experts,

L(u,a,b) and F(u) are defined in the [Materials] respectively. u is a variable. Which kernel should be used?
Thank you.

Hello
If F is a Material then we dont define its time derivative automatically.
I think you will want to rewrite F (dF/dt really) within the kernel. This will avoid having to deal with interactions between the time integrator and a time_derivative_material_property.
EDIT: I saw dt not du
You can load L using getMaterialProperty in your custom kernel
Guillaume

If I use AllenCahn [kernel]，I think the form is the same. Can I do this
[kern_1]
  type = AllenCahn
  variable = u
  f_name = F
  mob_name = L
  args = 'a b'
[]

Thank you.
the form looks the same indeed. I edited the syntax directly in your post
OK, I see. Thank you.

node.title: errow in setting thermal-conductivity coupled temperature
node.bodyText:
hi,
I want to set thermal-conductivity coupled temperature.
[Materials]
  [thermal]
    type = HeatConductionMaterial
    temp = T
    thermal_conductivity_temperature_function = 0.1*T
  []
[]

It shows: The following error occurred in the object "MOOSE Problem", of type "FEProblem".Unable to find function 0.1*T
When I set a parsed function K in [functin], and then thermal_conductivity_temperature_function = k,  it will run.
But parsed function can only couple xyzt.
Thanks in advance for your help!

Hello
0.1 * T is not a "Function" in MOOSE because it depends on a variable, and it's not in the format MOOSE expects for two reasons:


In general only the ParsedXXX objects will accept this sort of syntax (except with constants, constant parsing is widely supported)


This parameter likely expects a 1D function that maps temperature to thermal conductivity. You can easily reproduce 0.1 T with a real Function by specifying a PiecewiseLinear function for example.


Note: this parameter abuses Functions in that it takes 'x' to be temperature. So instead of having a spatial dependence, they have a temperature dependence. The ParsedFunction you could pass here would be: 0.1 * x
Guillaume

Thanks a lot ！Your answer solves my problem perfectly ！
I would like to ask a further question.
I want to get 2Dor3D function that maps temperature to thermal conductivity,   is PiecewiseLinear function up to the work？

we dont support that.
Using T as the 'x' coordinate is kind of a hack.
You definitely could implement something like using P and T as x and y, but it would likely be new code
Thanks!
Thanks!

node.title: Hex VTK Parallel Bug
node.bodyText:
Hi All
I think there is a bug from libmesh, when running an hex problem in parallel there are oddies along the domain processor boundaries, e.g.

Am I doing something odd, or is this a known problem? Key thing, this is using VTK out
Thanks
Andy
@roystgnr has the VTK output been set up for IGA?
Sorry I originally tagged this as an IGA mesh, it isn't its a hex mesh

Is the exodus output normal btw?
And what kind of Hex is this?

It's been set up; not sure how reliable it is.  CoreForm wrote the VTK+IGA code, we got it all merged in libMesh and MOOSE including VTK-based XML diff tests in #20783 ... and then we started seeing diffs on older build boxes upgrading to VTK 9.0.  I thought VTK 9.1 was safe, but digging back into it I don't see any response from @loganharbour to my question in #21449 and I'm not liking the strikethrough in the comment in #21450 ...
Hey Andy ( @makeclean ), we need some more info here.  Is this only with VTK - or does this happen with Exodus output as well?  Are you using a pre-split mesh?  Can you post the mesh file somewhere?
I've not tried with exodus, I'll try and report back. It is not pre-split, I can post inputs & mesh no problem.

Any update on this?
@friedmud did you get the chance to check out the mesh?

node.title: Updating variable at the end of the time step
node.bodyText:
Hello everyone,
Is there a way to manually update a variable say, elastic strain to a value of zero at a particular region based on the order parameter at the end of every timestep?
Thanks,
Bala

Hello
I think a ConstantAux(Kernel) does most of what you're looking for
(https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/auxkernels/ConstantAux.html)
You mean the order parameter of the variable? You'll have to modify the AuxKernel for that.
You can get the order with .order() from a variable, as shown here for a base class that your variable likely inherits from (https://mooseframework.inl.gov/docs/doxygen/moose/classMooseVariableBase.html)
Best,
Guillaume

Thank you @GiudGiud . I will try out the options.
Essentially, I need to bring elastic strain to zero(at the end of each timestep) at parts of the domain where the phase field variable is 0 in order to compensate for the lack of stiffness in those regions.
Thanks,
Bala

Are your displacement variables nonlinear? If so this won't work.
You'll have to modify the Strain/Stress calculator to achieve that.

Let me clarify. There are two types of variables in MOOSE, Variables and AuxVariables. The Variables are essentially solutions to your system, and AuxVariables, according to their names, are auxilliary, and you can set their values manually as you wish. You cannot run AuxKernels on Variables.
I guess you have displacement variables in your input files, and they are Variables instead of AuxVariables. In your input file, you might have a strain calculator that calculates a material property called "elastic_strain" or "mechanical_strain" based on the current displacements. What you want to do here, is to add a condition in your strain calculator such that, if the value of your coupled order parameter is above (or below) certain value, you set the _elastic_strain[_qp] = 0. There might be existing classes for this particular purpose.
Thank you for the explanation @hugary1995 . This is exactly what I want. Yes, my displacements are variables.

I have been trying to write an if condition such that the body of the if condition executes at the end of timestep. How do I access exec_timestep_end? Or is there any other way to make a custom user material access the end of timestep?
Thanks,
Bala

sorry we missed this.
You can get the current execute on flag from the fe_problem with the getCurrentExecuteOnFlag routine

node.title: --recover failing to find checkpoint files/headers
node.bodyText:
Hi, I am trying to test MOOSE's --recover feature, using the following input file:
Thermal_Linear.i
[Mesh]
  [Block]
    type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
    dim = 3
    xmax = 10
    ymax = 10
    zmax = 10
    nx = 10
    ny = 10
    nz = 10
  []
[]

[Variables]
  [temperature]
    initial_condition = 1000
  []
[]

[Kernels]
  [HeatConduction]
    type = ADHeatConduction
    variable = temperature
  []
  [HeatConductionTimeDerivative]
    type = ADHeatConductionTimeDerivative
    variable = temperature
  []
[]

[BCs]
  [Rad]
    type = ADFunctionRadiativeBC
    variable = temperature
    boundary = 'front back top bottom left right'
    Tinfinity = 300.0
    stefan_boltzmann_constant = 5.67037e-11
    emissivity_function = 0.6
  []
  [Conv]
    type = ADConvectiveHeatFluxBC
    variable = temperature
    boundary = 'front back top bottom left right'
    T_infinity = 300.0
    heat_transfer_coefficient = 0.02
  []
[]

[Materials]
  [Properties]
    type = ADGenericConstantMaterial
    prop_names =  'density thermal_conductivity specific_heat'
    prop_values = '0.01    10                   100'
  []
[]

# Preconditioner
[Preconditioning]
  [SMP]
    type = SMP
    full = true
  []
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient

  start_time = 0.0
  
  dt = 2.5

  solve_type = 'NEWTON'
  automatic_scaling = true

  residual_and_jacobian_together = True
  reuse_preconditioner = True

  line_search = default
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-10
  nl_rel_tol = 2e-08
  l_max_its = 200
[]

[Outputs]
  [Checkpoint]
    type = Checkpoint
    num_files = 3
  []
[]



which I run with the following:
./my_app -i Thermal_Linear.i

From the top level of the moose app directory.
This creates checkpoint files as expected in "Thermal_Linear_Checkpoint_cp", with contents as shown in the image.

However, after cancelling the simulation at a random point to simulate a crash/error of some kind (by simply hitting ctrl+c), running this command:
./my_app -i Thermal_Linear.i --recover

Leads to the following error:
*** ERROR ***
ERROR: Neither one of the following files can be located:
        '_mesh.cpr/1/header.cpr' nor
        '_mesh.cpr'
If you are running a parallel job, double check that you've created a split for 1 ranks.
Note: One of paths above may refer to a valid directory on your system, however we are attempting to read a valid header file.

Even though those files are present (3 versions of them, given the num_files = 3 flag in the input file)
Why is this happening? Thanks for any advice you can provide.

Hello
You just need to provide the file name base / folder on the command line after --recover
Guillaume

Ah, I thought that those were determined automatically, thank you! Running the command:
./my_app -i Thermal_Linear --recover Thermal_Linear_Checkpoint_cp/0008

Works 👍

node.title: Elastic driving force for grain growth: lack of documentation of Euler angle file
node.bodyText:
Hi all, I'm studying the case of poly_grain_growth_2D_eldrforce.i. Line 36 of this example requires an associated .tex file containing a set of Euler angles corresponding to each grain number, called grn_36_rand_2D.tex, but I have not seen documentation of this file. I was wondering if this was somewhere available.
Thank you!

Hello
This object has indeed not been documented
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/userobjects/EulerAngleFileReader.html
You can try to mimick the syntax used in the list of input files (and their associated angles files) shown by this documentation page.
If you run into any issues, @permcody or @amjokisaari will be able to help you
Guillaume

node.title: HarmonicAverage
node.bodyText: It looks like HarmonicAverage is not a member of the Moose::FV::InterpMethod although there are examples (https://mooseframework.inl.gov/syntax/FVKernels/) that include HarmonicAverage as member of it. Will HarmonicAverage be added to that namespace?
Ah, OK - thanks!

the second one will definitely not allow harmonic.
Could you please paste the input file syntax that fails with the first one?
params is mispelled as paras btw.
can you please paste the entire validParams block for your object?

Is TAO also added to the main branch or is it still in a develop branch?
…
On Wed, Oct 5, 2022 at 8:30 AM Guillaume Giudicelli < ***@***.***> wrote:
 Hello

 It is, did you update to the latest moose? We only added this recently.

 In FVDiffusion you can see:

   const auto & interp_method = getParam<MooseEnum>("coeff_interp_method");
   if (interp_method == "average")
     _coeff_interp_method = Moose::FV::InterpMethod::Average;
   else if (interp_method == "harmonic")
     _coeff_interp_method = Moose::FV::InterpMethod::HarmonicAverage;

 .
 You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID:
 ***@***.***>


-- 
Olle Heinonen
***@***.***

Still in this branch:
#21887
if you need both you should be able to rebase it on top of devel

Cool - thanks!
…
On Wed, Oct 5, 2022 at 9:04 AM Guillaume Giudicelli < ***@***.***> wrote:
 Still in this branch:
 #21887 <#21887>

 if you need both you should be able to rebase it on top of devel

 —
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#22306 (reply in thread)>,
 or unsubscribe
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AEKZEF2KEQFKPCWRQ2JXYHDWBWDFXANCNFSM6AAAAAAQ5SRO3Q>
 .
 You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID:
 ***@***.***>


-- 
Olle Heinonen
***@***.***

I just copy pasted this all into FVDiffusion and it ran fine.
except for this:
const auto _coeff_interp_method = Moose::FV::InterpMethod::Average;
this is not what we want. _coeff_interp_method is a class attribute its type should not be declared in the source but in the header
If you update MOOSE again, I just add a selectInterpolationMethod routine that does this for you.
you call it like in FVDiffusion.C
    _coeff_interp_method(
        Moose::FV::selectInterpolationMethod(getParam<MooseEnum>("coeff_interp_method")))

Thanks, Guillaume.
…
On Wed, Oct 19, 2022 at 6:15 PM Guillaume Giudicelli < ***@***.***> wrote:
 I just copy pasted this all into FVDiffusion and it ran fine.
 except for this:

 const auto _coeff_interp_method = Moose::FV::InterpMethod::Average;
 this is not what we want. _coeff_interp_method is a class attribute its
 type should not be declared in the source but in the header

 If you update MOOSE again, I just add a selectInterpolationMethod routine
 that does this for you.
 you call it like in FVDiffusion.C

     _coeff_interp_method(
         Moose::FV::selectInterpolationMethod(getParam<MooseEnum>("coeff_interp_method")))

node.title: PorousFlow - Two phase injection
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
Following up with the problem described here #22251 .- where I have a two layered system (aquitard - aquifer) which is saturated with water. A borehole injects gas into the aquifer.
I made a small MOOSE model to simulate this system. However, I have problems making the model converge. Looks like injection of water works fine, but convergence problems raise with the gas.
My code is here: https://github.com/wangshengwa/PorousFlow-stuff/tree/main/2pf_inj
Thanks I appreciate any help to make this work.
Cheers!
Wang

Hello
Do you get convergence with LU?
I noticed you have a lu block set up.
Guillaume
Thanks @GiudGiud , looks like I made a mistake in my dirackernels. Thanks!

A couple of things that might help:

I think that you need pgas >= pwater (at least I think that is the convention), so you probably want to initialise pgas = pwater
You might need fluid_phase = 1 in the borehole (phase 0 is water, phase 1 is gas)
Likewise, mass_fraction_component should probably be 1 (the gas) in the borehole

Let me know if these help!

Hi @cpgr
Thanks a lot! I changed  fluid_phase=1 and mass_fraction_component=1
I also reduced the tolerance to nl_abs_tol = 1E-6
Now it works!
However, I have numerical overshoots. I thought that KT  + superbee my help, but my model is still overshooting. Can you advise of how can I deal with this issue?
My model with KT stabilization: https://github.com/wangshengwa/PorousFlow-stuff/tree/main/2pf_kt
Cheers!
Wang
Is the recorded wellbore flow oscillating, or is it something else? I haven't had a chance to look at it today, I'll try tomorrow.
The pore pressure of the gas takes negative values of order 1E5. Thanks!
I think it is probably an issue with your well, rather than something that could be fixed by stabilisation. @WilkAndy - any ideas?

My suggestion is to copy the various similar examples in PorousFlow
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/porous_flow/tests/dirackernels/dirackernels_tests.html
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/porous_flow/sinks.html
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/porous_flow/tests/fluidstate/fluidstate_tests.html
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/porous_flow/tests/buckley_leverett/buckley_leverett_tests.html
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/porous_flow/thm_example.html

node.title: error in Compile libMesh for HPC Cluster installation
node.bodyText:
Hi there,
I got the following error in moose installation. I have attached the terminal outputs. Could you please help me to solve the issue?
output.txt
Thank you very much!
Amir

Hello
Seems you are missing some libraries to install libmesh
In particular look at libtirpc-devel, see if it is installed on your system
Guillaume

see this post for more details
#20479

Thanks Guillaume, I have checked the #20479, unfortunately, it does not work for me yet. The libtirpc-devel version is 1.1.4.
output_libtirpc_devel.txt. Thank you for your help!

well even if you do have it installed, libmesh is not finding it.
Please have a look at Roy's answer in that thread to help it find the file
#20479 (reply in thread)

I found the rpc.h/xdr.h in the "/usr/include/tirpc" path. How can I address it for limbash?
the following comand doesn't work:
$./scripts/update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh configure CPPFLAGS=/usr/include/tirpc/rpc/
does CPPFLAGS need to be passed before the command?

also you do not want to erase CPPFLAGS and set it to this value, you only want to amend it so:
CPPFLAGS=/usr/include/tirpc/rpc/:$CPPFLAGS

Hi @GiudGiud @Amir1361 ,
I have the same error while trying to compile libmesh on a cluster where I have to load libtirpc externally via a module. I can see that the files rpc/rpc.h and rpc/xdr.h are located in $LIBTIRPC_MODULE_PATH/include/tirpc.
The command I am trying to run is:
./scripts/update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh CPPFLAGS=-I/$LIBTIRPC_MODULE_PATH/include/tirpc 
But the error is still:
checking for XDR support in /usr/include/tirpc... no
configure: error: *** XDR was not found, but --enable-xdr-required was specified.

Did you manage to solve your problem @Amir1361 ?
Is there a mistake I am making? 
Cheers,
 Martin

Hello you neee to install libtirpc-devel on your system
is this a computing cluster or your own machine?

Thank you for your answer @GiudGiud, it's a computing cluster.
Is the libtirpc-devel a different library than libtirpc? Would you mind giving me more details on how to install that then?
If it s a computing cluster, the easiest is to ask your cluster administrators to install it

Hello,
Here are the outputs for Compile Limbash and Compile & Test Moose. It seems that I do not have "Python.h". Could you please help me with this issue? Thanks,
Amir
install.txt
test.txt

Missing python.h usually means something is wrong with your python, like you only have an old python 2.7 for example.
What do the following return:
echo $CXX
which mpicc
which python
python --version

Guillaume

Hi Guillaume,
Here are the outputs. Thank you for your help!

Missing python.h means python-devel packages are not installed (when using system Python such as /usr/bin/).
Edit: Actually this pretty much sums it up: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/21530577/fatal-error-python-h-no-such-file-or-directory
@milljm and @GiudGiud Thank you very much!
